trans-unit.source: Provides data for the context menu event.
Gets the horizontal position of the mouse.
When the user opens a context menu by right clicking the mouse, this property returns the position of the mouse.

Specifying the position of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenu> by setting the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenu.PlacementTarget%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenu.PlacementRectangle%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenu.Placement%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenu.HorizontalOffset%2A>, or <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenu.VerticalOffsetProperty> properties does not affect the value of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenuEventArgs.CursorLeft%2A>.
When the user opens a context menu by using the keyboard, or when the context menu closes, the value of this property is -1.
The horizontal position of the mouse.
Gets the vertical position of the mouse.
When the user opens a context menu by right clicking the mouse, this property returns the position of the mouse.

Specifying the position of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenu> by setting the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenu.PlacementTarget%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenu.PlacementRectangle%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenu.Placement%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenu.HorizontalOffset%2A>, or <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenu.VerticalOffsetProperty> properties does not affect the value of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenuEventArgs.CursorTop%2A>.
When the user opens a context menu by using the keyboard, or when the context menu closes, the value of this property is -1.
The vertical position of the mouse.
